Frobenius normalization

Source: R/normalization.R
frobNorm.Rd

This function computes the Frobenius normalization of a matrix.

Usage

frobNorm(X)

Arguments

X

Numeric matrix of any size. It may be a kernel matrix.

Value

Frobenius-normalized X (class: "matrix").

Examples

dat <- matrix(rnorm(50),ncol=5,nrow=10)
frobNorm(dat)
#>              [,1]        [,2]        [,3]        [,4]         [,5]
#>  [1,] -0.17950115  0.09741912 -0.12926209  0.11081521  0.023787870
#>  [2,]  0.05972679  0.12270525 -0.11045850  0.23828370  0.196333575
#>  [3,] -0.02348416  0.11438400  0.07598117  0.02074774 -0.131957336
#>  [4,] -0.10635057 -0.07725894  0.04294729  0.14483213 -0.145851488
#>  [5,]  0.04735028 -0.07426241  0.13850323  0.12015496 -0.006378478
#>  [6,] -0.12042047  0.38378659  0.06563148 -0.17061251  0.051396769
#>  [7,]  0.12275937 -0.22208435  0.01782928  0.20106857 -0.080136333
#>  [8,]  0.01102490  0.08081502 -0.28671392 -0.04038845  0.070205573
#>  [9,]  0.15868728 -0.01163804  0.08361512  0.20052225 -0.173707749
#> [10,] -0.01934217  0.02086693 -0.20604122  0.33012838 -0.052663055
